bug.short_desc: F1 shows up when typing Insert/Home/End/Page Up/Page Down on a web page

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
F1's popup shows up when browsing on a random web page and typing one of these special keys: "Insert", "Home", "End", "Page Up" or "Page Down".
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Go to http://www.gnu.org/ 2. Type either "Insert", "Home", "End", "Page Up" or "Page Down". 3. F1's popup shows up.
Expected Results: F1's popup should not show up.

All I did was updating to the latest version of F1, the one without need to restart the browser.
This is also happening with the following keys: "Tab", "Win" (both), "Context menu", "Pause | Attn" or some combinations of Ctrl + key not tied to a context (e.g. Ctrl + V everywhere except in a field or a textarea).
Note: I use a Dell L100 keyboard (French version).
